org.fxmisc.richtext

Class StyledTextArea<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • org.fxmisc.richtext.StyledTextArea<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - type of style that can be applied to text.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Styleable, EventTarget, Skinnable, ClipboardActions<S>, EditActions<S>, NavigationActions<S>, TextEditingArea<S>, TwoDimensional, UndoActions<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InlineStyleTextArea, StyleClassedTextArea

    public class StyledTextArea<S>
extends Control
implements TextEditingArea<S>, EditActions<S>, ClipboardActions<S>, NavigationActions<S>, UndoActions<S>, TwoDimensional
    Text editing control. Accepts user input (keyboard, mouse) and provides API to assign style to text ranges. It is suitable for syntax highlighting and rich-text editors.

    Subclassing is allowed to define the type of style, e.g. inline style or style classes.

    Overriding keyboard shortcuts

    StyledTextArea comes with Node.onKeyTypedProperty() and Node.onKeyPressedProperty() handlers installed to handle keyboard input. Ordinary character input is handled by the onKeyTyped handler and control key combinations (including Enter and Tab) are handled by the onKeyPressed handler. To add or override some keyboard shortcuts, but keep the rest in place, you would combine the default event handler with a new one that adds or overrides some of the default key combinations. This is how to bind Ctrl+S to the save() operation: 
     
 import static javafx.scene.input.KeyCode.*;
 import static javafx.scene.input.KeyCombination.*;
 import static org.fxmisc.wellbehaved.event.EventPattern.*;

 import org.fxmisc.wellbehaved.event.EventHandlerHelper;

 EventHandler<? super KeyEvent> ctrlS = EventHandlerHelper
         .on(keyPressed(S, CONTROL_DOWN)).act(event -> save())
         .create();

 EventHandlerHelper.install(area.onKeyPressedProperty(), ctrlS);

      • font

        public final StyleableObjectProperty<Font> fontProperty
        The default font to use where font is not specified otherwise.
        See Also:
        getFont(), setFont(Font)

      • popupWindow

        public ObjectProperty<PopupWindow> popupWindowProperty
        Popup window that will be positioned by this text area relative to the caret or selection. Use popupAlignmentProperty() to specify how the popup should be positioned relative to the caret or selection. Use popupAnchorOffsetProperty() or popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty() to further adjust the position.
        See Also:
        getPopupWindow(), setPopupWindow(PopupWindow)

      • popupAtCaret

        @Deprecated
public ObjectProperty<PopupWindow> popupAtCaretProperty
        See Also:
        getPopupAtCaret(), setPopupAtCaret(PopupWindow)

      • popupAnchorOffset

        public ObjectProperty<Point2D> popupAnchorOffsetProperty
        Specifies further offset (in pixels) of the popup window from the position specified by popupAlignmentProperty().

        If popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty() is also specified, then it overrides the offset set by this property.

        See Also:
        getPopupAnchorOffset(), setPopupAnchorOffset(Point2D)

      • popupAnchorAdjustment

        public ObjectProperty<UnaryOperator<Point2D>> popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty
        Specifies how to adjust the popup window's anchor point. The given operator is invoked with the screen position calculated according to popupAlignmentProperty() and should return a new screen position. This position will be used as the popup window's anchor point.

        Setting this property overrides popupAnchorOffsetProperty().

        See Also:
        getPopupAnchorAdjustment(), setPopupAnchorAdjustment(UnaryOperator)

      • popupAlignment

        public ObjectProperty<PopupAlignment> popupAlignmentProperty
        Defines where the popup window given in popupWindowProperty() is be anchored, i.e. where its anchor point is positioned. This position can further be adjusted by popupAnchorOffsetProperty() or popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty().
        See Also:
        getPopupAlignment(), setPopupAlignment(PopupAlignment)

      • mouseOverTextDelay

        public ObjectProperty<Duration> mouseOverTextDelayProperty
        Defines how long the mouse has to stay still over the text before a MouseOverTextEvent of type MOUSE_OVER_TEXT_BEGIN is fired on this text area. When set to null, no MouseOverTextEvents are fired on this text area.

        Default value is null.

        See Also:
        getMouseOverTextDelay(), setMouseOverTextDelay(Duration)

      • paragraphGraphicFactory

        public ObjectProperty<IntFunction<? extends Node>> paragraphGraphicFactoryProperty
        See Also:
        getParagraphGraphicFactory(), setParagraphGraphicFactory(IntFunction)

      • useInitialStyleForInsertion

        public BooleanProperty useInitialStyleForInsertionProperty
        See Also:
        getUseInitialStyleForInsertion(), setUseInitialStyleForInsertion(boolean)

      • StyledTextArea

        public StyledTextArea(S initialStyle,
                      BiConsumer<Text,S> applyStyle)
        Creates a text area with empty text content.
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - style to use in places where no other style is specified (yet).
        applyStyle - function that, given a Text node and a style, applies the style to the text node. This function is used by the default skin to apply style to text nodes.

      • getPopupWindow

        public PopupWindow getPopupWindow()
        Gets the value of the property popupWindow.

      • popupWindowProperty

        public ObjectProperty<PopupWindow> popupWindowProperty()
        Popup window that will be positioned by this text area relative to the caret or selection. Use popupAlignmentProperty() to specify how the popup should be positioned relative to the caret or selection. Use popupAnchorOffsetProperty() or popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty() to further adjust the position.
        See Also:
        getPopupWindow(), setPopupWindow(PopupWindow)

      • setPopupAnchorOffset

        public void setPopupAnchorOffset(Point2D offset)
        Sets the value of the property popupAnchorOffset.

      • getPopupAnchorOffset

        public Point2D getPopupAnchorOffset()
        Gets the value of the property popupAnchorOffset.

      • popupAnchorOffsetProperty

        public ObjectProperty<Point2D> popupAnchorOffsetProperty()
        Specifies further offset (in pixels) of the popup window from the position specified by popupAlignmentProperty().

        If popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty() is also specified, then it overrides the offset set by this property.

        See Also:
        getPopupAnchorOffset(), setPopupAnchorOffset(Point2D)

      • setPopupAnchorAdjustment

        public void setPopupAnchorAdjustment(UnaryOperator<Point2D> f)
        Sets the value of the property popupAnchorAdjustment.

      • getPopupAnchorAdjustment

        public UnaryOperator<Point2D> getPopupAnchorAdjustment()
        Gets the value of the property popupAnchorAdjustment.

      • popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty

        public ObjectProperty<UnaryOperator<Point2D>> popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty()
        Specifies how to adjust the popup window's anchor point. The given operator is invoked with the screen position calculated according to popupAlignmentProperty() and should return a new screen position. This position will be used as the popup window's anchor point.

        Setting this property overrides popupAnchorOffsetProperty().

        See Also:
        getPopupAnchorAdjustment(), setPopupAnchorAdjustment(UnaryOperator)

      • setPopupAlignment

        public void setPopupAlignment(PopupAlignment pos)
        Sets the value of the property popupAlignment.

      • getPopupAlignment

        public PopupAlignment getPopupAlignment()
        Gets the value of the property popupAlignment.

      • popupAlignmentProperty

        public ObjectProperty<PopupAlignment> popupAlignmentProperty()
        Defines where the popup window given in popupWindowProperty() is be anchored, i.e. where its anchor point is positioned. This position can further be adjusted by popupAnchorOffsetProperty() or popupAnchorAdjustmentProperty().
        See Also:
        getPopupAlignment(), setPopupAlignment(PopupAlignment)

      • setMouseOverTextDelay

        public void setMouseOverTextDelay(Duration delay)
        Sets the value of the property mouseOverTextDelay.

      • getMouseOverTextDelay

        public Duration getMouseOverTextDelay()
        Gets the value of the property mouseOverTextDelay.

      • mouseOverTextDelayProperty

        public ObjectProperty<Duration> mouseOverTextDelayProperty()
        Defines how long the mouse has to stay still over the text before a MouseOverTextEvent of type MOUSE_OVER_TEXT_BEGIN is fired on this text area. When set to null, no MouseOverTextEvents are fired on this text area.

        Default value is null.

        See Also:
        getMouseOverTextDelay(), setMouseOverTextDelay(Duration)

        public void setUseInitialStyleForInsertion(boolean value)
        Indicates whether the initial style should also be used for plain text inserted into this text area. When false, the style immediately preceding the insertion position is used. Default value is false.

      • getParagraphSelection

        public IndexRange getParagraphSelection(int paragraph)
        Returns the selection range in the given paragraph.

      • getStyleOfChar

        public S getStyleOfChar(int index)
        Returns the style of the character with the given index. If index points to a line terminator character, the last style used in the paragraph terminated by that line terminator is returned.

      • getStyleAtPosition

        public S getStyleAtPosition(int position)
        Returns the style at the given position. That is the style of the character immediately preceding position, except when position points to a paragraph boundary, in which case it is the style at the beginning of the latter paragraph.

        In other words, most of the time getStyleAtPosition(p) is equivalent to getStyleOfChar(p-1), except when p points to a paragraph boundary, in which case it is equivalent to getStyleOfChar(p).

      • getStyleRangeAtPosition

        public IndexRange getStyleRangeAtPosition(int position)
        Returns the range of homogeneous style that includes the given position. If position points to a boundary between two styled ranges, then the range preceding position is returned. If position points to a boundary between two paragraphs, then the first styled range of the latter paragraph is returned.

      • getStyleSpans

        public StyleSpans<S> getStyleSpans(int from,
                                   int to)
        Returns the styles in the given character range.

      • getStyleSpans

        public StyleSpans<S> getStyleSpans(IndexRange range)
        Returns the styles in the given character range.

      • getStyleOfChar

        public S getStyleOfChar(int paragraph,
                        int index)
        Returns the style of the character with the given index in the given paragraph. If index is beyond the end of the paragraph, the style at the end of line is returned. If index is negative, it is the same as if it was 0.

      • getStyleAtPosition

        public S getStyleAtPosition(int paragraph,
                            int position)
        Returns the style at the given position in the given paragraph. This is equivalent to getStyleOfChar(paragraph, position-1).

      • getStyleRangeAtPosition

        public IndexRange getStyleRangeAtPosition(int paragraph,
                                          int position)
        Returns the range of homogeneous style that includes the given position in the given paragraph. If position points to a boundary between two styled ranges, then the range preceding position is returned.

      • getStyleSpans

        public StyleSpans<S> getStyleSpans(int paragraph)
        Returns styles of the whole paragraph.

                     int from,

                     S style)

      • setStyleSpans

        public void setStyleSpans(int from,
                          StyleSpans<? extends S> styleSpans)
        Set multiple style ranges at once. This is equivalent to 
         for(StyleSpan <S> span: styleSpans) {
     setStyle(from, from + span.getLength(), span.getStyle());
     from += span.getLength();
 }
        but the actual implementation is more efficient.

      • setStyleSpans

        public void setStyleSpans(int paragraph,
                          int from,
                          StyleSpans<? extends S> styleSpans)
        Set multiple style ranges of a paragraph at once. This is equivalent to 
         for(StyleSpan <S> span: styleSpans) {
     setStyle(paragraph, from, from + span.getLength(), span.getStyle());
     from += span.getLength();
 }
        but the actual implementation is more efficient.

      • replaceText

        public void replaceText(int start,
                        int end,
                        String text)
        Description copied from interface: TextEditingArea
        Replaces a range of characters with the given text. It must hold 0 <= start <= end <= getLength().
        Specified by:
        replaceText in interface TextEditingArea<S>
        Parameters:
        start - Start index of the range to replace, inclusive.
        end - End index of the range to replace, exclusive.
        text - The text to put in place of the deleted range. It must not be null.

      • positionCaret

        public void positionCaret(int pos)
        Description copied from interface: TextEditingArea
        Positions only the caret. Doesn't move the anchor and doesn't change the selection. Can be used to achieve the special case of positioning the caret outside or inside the selection, as opposed to always being at the boundary. Use with care.
        Specified by:
        positionCaret in interface TextEditingArea<S>
